title.narrative: Conservation of the Ancient Maya Ruins of Chetumal at Santa Rita Archaeological Site

description.narrative: To support the conservation of several ruined structures at Santa Rita Archaeological Site, the original location of the Pre-Columbian Maya city of Chetumal. Exposure to the elements, vandalism, and the continuing urbanization and encroachment of adjacent town of Corozal are impacting the ancient structures of Chetumal. This project includes site preparation activities, conservation work, and site protection measures to safeguard the integrity of the site.

title.narrative: Conservation of the Early Classic Maya Monuments in the Lamanai Archaeological Reserve

description.narrative: Continuously inhabited for over 3,000 years, with major monuments from the Maya period, Lamanai is one the most visited and best known archaeological sites in Belize. This project involves the preventive conservation of seven Early Classic Maya (250-600 AD) monuments to mitigate deterioration.

title.narrative: In Service Training Project Individual Grant MA

description.narrative: In Service Training Project Individual Grant MA Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.
